revised_title: On Apogamy and the Development of Sporangia upon Fern Prothalli
tldr: The authors investigate the occurrence of apogamy and the development of sporangia on fern prothalli under controlled cultivation conditions. They observe that exposure to direct sunlight and increased temperature may affect the growth of prothalli, and discuss the implications of these findings on the nature of alternation of generations in archegoniate plants.
